page.title: 01SUMMARY OF CONDOVER AREA.
page.content: The area comprises an attractive village,designated a conservation area,situated four miles South of the county town of Shrewsbury,and occupying a well wooded site on the plain surrounding the Cound brook.It is probably from this brook that the village takes its name.The village is characterised by a wide variety of architectural styles featuring interesting sandstone walling and yew hedging.Its outstanding feature is Condover Hall probably the finest Elizabethan house in Shropshire, situated on the edge of the village, adjacent to the church and in a setting of formal gardens and avenues. The parish church dates back to Norman times.The remainder of the area is rural though a small industrial site and sand quarry exist.
